revised_title: Ariel III Satellite Observations of Molecular Oxygen in the Thermosphere
tldr: The Ariel III satellite measured molecular oxygen distribution in the thermosphere by observing the attenuation of solar radiation. The experiment used ionization chambers to detect molecular oxygen, which has a strong absorption at a wavelength of about 145 nm. The data collected during the first 10 days of operation showed a large and systematic variation with longitude, providing valuable insights into the thermosphere's molecular oxygen distribution.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
